p: The kinetics of antibody production in dengue follow the typical course found in many viral infections with an initial phase of IgM production followed by IgG. During a primary DENV infection, antidengue IgM levels will begin to rise 3–5 days following the onset of fever and are detected in almost all cases following defervescence. Over the next 2–3 months, IgM levels fall and are replaced by IgG, which can be detected lifelong and are proposed to provide protection from repeat infection with that serotype, but not against reinfection with a different serotype ( Halstead, 1988, Innis et al., 1989, Kurane, 2007, Sabin, 1952, Summers et al., 1984).
